70billion -rrb- deficit . au revoir : actor gerard depardieu recently announced his intention to turn in his french passport and move to a village in a tax-friendly belgium . prime minister jean-marc ayrault was quick to respond , saying in a statement following the decision that the government would resubmit the measure to take the court 's concerns into account . the court 's ruling took issue not with the size of the tax , but with the way it discriminated between households depending on how incomes were distributed among its members . a household with two earners each making under $ 1million -lrb- # 820,000 -rrb- would be exempt from the tax , while one with one earner making $ 1.2 million -lrb- # 980,000 -rrb- would have to pay . the french government approved the tax in its most recent budget , amid criticism that it would do little to stem the country 's mounting fiscal problems and would drive away the wealthiest citizens . meanwhile president hollande 's popularity has been tanking as the country 's unemployment continued its rise for the 19th straight month . france 's most famous actor gerard depardieu recently announced his intention to turn in his french passport and move to a village in a tax-friendly belgium .
